ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Foreign body in ear canal (Hearing Aid Battery)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Otoscopy revealed a #312 hearing aid battery firmly adhered to the right ear canal wall.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Underlying bilateral symmetrical mild-to-severe hearing loss established at baseline.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Initial comprehensive assessment of hearing sensitivity.
Assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
Fit amplification to address hearing loss.
Verify hearing aid function during follow-up check.
Investigate cause of reduced hearing aid benefit and check ear canal status.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Baseline evaluation revealed bilateral symmetrical mild-to-severe sensorineural hearing loss with normal middle ear function. Speech understanding in quiet was good, but speech-in-noise testing showed moderate SNR loss.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral symmetrical mild to severe sensorineural hearing loss, gradually sloping.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs (45-48 dB HL) consistent with pure tones; WRS slight loss (86-88% at 85 dB HL).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal Type A tympanograms with normal volume and compliance.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Normal contralateral and ipsilateral thresholds at 1000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise
tests.result_summary: QuickSIN revealed a moderate SNR loss of 12 dB bilaterally.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: SR was fitted bilaterally with digitally programmable receiver-in-the-ear (RITE) instruments that used no. 312 batteries. The fitting required more counseling than usual due to the patient's reduced understanding of use and care.

tests.name: Hearing aid fitting
tests.result_summary: Bilateral RITE instruments fitted. Patient required extensive counseling on use and care.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Routine hearing aid check confirmed devices were functioning correctly.

tests.name: Electroacoustic analysis
tests.result_summary: Revealed proper functioning of the hearing instruments.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Investigation into reduced hearing aid benefit revealed a foreign body in the right ear canal, identified as a hearing aid battery.

tests.name: Otoscopy
tests.result_summary: Debris observed close to TM; upon attempted removal with curette, object was solid, hard, and adhered to wall. Identified as #312 battery.

proposed_items: Attempted mechanical removal with ear curette (failed due to adherence)
Immediate referral to otologist for removal
Reinstruction on proper hearing aid care and battery insertion (post-removal)
counseling_actions: Informed patient the object is a battery, not wax
Explained the situation is a medical emergency due to risk of leakage and tissue damage
Advised against putting water or drops in the ear to prevent electrolyte leakage

red_flags_present: Foreign body in ear canal (hearing aid battery)
Object firmly adhered to canal wall

escalation.rationale_short: Battery in ear canal is an emergency due to risk of liquefaction necrosis; mechanical removal failed.

follow_up_plan.objective: Emergency removal of the battery by a specialist.

expected_outcome: Otoscopy: No observable changes to the right ear canal following battery removal.
Pure-tone audiometry: No change in pure-tone thresholds following battery extraction.
Patient was reinstructed on the proper care and use of the instruments, especially in regard to proper battery insertion.
